Structure
Dr. Dorothy Wrinch, of the Mathematics Institute at Oxford University, and at present working on the
Physico - chemical structure of the
chromosome, addressed the Biology
Faculty and Graduate Students last
Friday night.
During the last few years, Dr.
Wrinch has become interested in the
structure of the chromosomes, and
has attempted to correlate the work
of the geneticists and gytologists
with the present known knowledge
of organic molecules.
Speaking on "The Structure of the
Chromosome," Dr. Wrinch put forth
the theory that the chromosomes are
made up of threads of protarnines interlaced with nucleic acid molecules.
At the beginning of her talk she
pleads for more interrelation between
the fields of sicence, and asked more
chemists and physcists to Investigate the mysteries of biology.
Dr. Wrinch is at present on a five
year Rockefeller Grant to carry on
this correlation, and she is spending
part of that time here in Amorist
Jonferring with American Scientists.

The Blue Jay Booters beat the
Blue Ridge soccer team at Homewood Saturday by a score of 4-0.
The Blue Ridge team playing a hard
defense game finally yielded to the
Hopkins' assault when Linthicum
playing center forward for the Jays
dented the net with a fast boot from
close quarters.
Hopkins Scores Repeatedly
The second half opened with the
Blue Jays more determined than ever
to insure a quick victory. Three goals
were chalked up in short order by
Price, Hartke, and Brayshaw respectively as the Hopkins team continued their driving attack against
the less competent Mountaineers.
The Blue Ridge team was only
able to make four attempts at scoring throughout the entire game. The
Hopkins' defense proved invincible
while the offense time and again
thwarted the Blue Ridge Booters with
their clever dribbling and passing.

Structure
Dr. Dorothy Wrinch, of the Mathematics Institute at Oxford University, and at present working on the
Physico - chemical structure of the
chromosome, addressed the Biology
Faculty and Graduate Students last
Friday night.
During the last few years, Dr.
Wrinch has become interested in the
structure of the chromosomes, and
has attempted to correlate the work
of the geneticists and gytologists
with the present known knowledge
of organic molecules.
Speaking on "The Structure of the
Chromosome," Dr. Wrinch put forth
the theory that the chromosomes are
made up of threads of protarnines interlaced with nucleic acid molecules.
At the beginning of her talk she
pleads for more interrelation between
the fields of sicence, and asked more
chemists and physcists to Investigate the mysteries of biology.
Dr. Wrinch is at present on a five
year Rockefeller Grant to carry on
this correlation, and she is spending
part of that time here in Amorist
Jonferring with American Scientists.

The Blue Jay Booters beat the
Blue Ridge soccer team at Homewood Saturday by a score of 4-0.
The Blue Ridge team playing a hard
defense game finally yielded to the
Hopkins' assault when Linthicum
playing center forward for the Jays
dented the net with a fast boot from
close quarters.
Hopkins Scores Repeatedly
The second half opened with the
Blue Jays more determined than ever
to insure a quick victory. Three goals
were chalked up in short order by
Price, Hartke, and Brayshaw respectively as the Hopkins team continued their driving attack against
the less competent Mountaineers.
The Blue Ridge team was only
able to make four attempts at scoring throughout the entire game. The
Hopkins' defense proved invincible
while the offense time and again
thwarted the Blue Ridge Booters with
their clever dribbling and passing.
